extendedInfo.description: Feast on the blood of a dying city: Memphis, 1873! Make your national debut in the Society, a conspiracy of vampires who convene in Memphis to elect a new "senator." The city burns with yellow fever, as the nascent Ku Klux Klan rises."Choice of the Vampire 2: The Fall of Memphis" is the sequel to 2010's hit "Choice of the Vampire," the epic interactive novel by Jason Stevan Hill where your choices determine how the story proceeds. The game is entirely text-based--without graphics or sound effects--but driven by the vast, unstoppable power of your imagination.What will you take from Memphis before the city collapses? Will you battle the Klan, or control them from within? Will you rekindle a romance that transcends death? The choice is yours.

reviews.title: Feels like the scope is too broad for the format
reviews.comment: I think what\'s unsatisfying for me is that there are too many stats and most of them don\'t seem to do anything. The plot also leaves you feeling like you haven\'t accomplished much and even after replays the end result is way too much the same. No sense of how anything affects anything else.
reviews.author: Ziyi Cai

reviews.title: Good but...
reviews.comment: Loved the first one, but the second one is honestly lackluster compared to it. I was quite honestly a little lost throughout the story and it felt like the choices were being pushed on me and they led to nowhere. It\'s way too short for the price.
reviews.author: Kwan Wai Teng

reviews.title: Disappointing
reviews.comment: Very short, not nearly as much fun as the first one. Absolutely no desire to replay it again due to how linear and monotonous it was. I wish I didn\'t have to pay for something this short after waiting so long.
reviews.author: Cal Green

reviews.title: Worth Supporting
reviews.comment: I have great respect for what Choice of Games have done in the past. Even now I am certain that they will surprise me with a fitting 3rd entry to choice of the vampire. With that said, the second part did not quite enthrall me as much as in the 1st; but I feel that they deserve an opportunity to show us they still have the ability to amaze us.
reviews.author: Josue Medina

reviews.title: meh needs more updates
reviews.comment: did not like that the choices made from party one did not carry over so i had to start again from new in party two
reviews.author: Lilly Auvrea\'mitore

reviews.title: A big step down for CoG
reviews.comment: Very short, and totally railroaded.
reviews.author: Alexey Murashkovsky

reviews.title: Not as great as the first one
reviews.comment: It is short and I thought it will have more options. I love the first game but they maybe needed to make the second one a little longer and have more choices.
reviews.author: Raven Burton

reviews.title: Waited so long for this one
reviews.comment: Not as long, but ok.  Edit: Gave it another go. It was short for the price, I felt like the options were being pushed upon me. It never really went anywhere. I was lost in the direction it went. I gave it 3 stars because I loved part 1 and love the work choice of games/hosted games release. But because of the disappointment as of late, I may take a break from them until I read reviews.
reviews.author: Angel T

reviews.title: decent game
reviews.comment: not as good as the first
reviews.author: Guuled Ismail

reviews.title: Not worth the cost for content provided
reviews.comment: Its not worth a purchase
reviews.author: Larry Bernard

reviews.title: Really waste of my money
reviews.comment: I loved the first 1 why I got the 2nd and it was just a huge let down I mean it was short and well a lil cheesy like they where trying too hard on the whole vampire society thing I gave two stars because of my love for the first
reviews.author: Jacob Asher

reviews.title: Not bad
reviews.comment: Playing it through the first time was great, but as I\'ve been playing it with different options I\'m a little disappointed in some of the story elements.  There points where the storyline is forced on you with no plausible lead into the forced story.  I haven\'t played ALL available options, but it feels like there are gaps.  On the whole I\'ve enjoyed the game, but replaying it isn\'t as enjoyable as I feel it could be.
reviews.author: krys brazie

reviews.title: Lacks Bite
reviews.comment: For a sequel, it didn\'t have much to do with the first game. Hardly any of the plot threads from the first game came up.  It introduces way too many new characters, and locks a lot of potentially interesting information behind stat walls.   The political aspects of the game are disappointing - you can\'t really change any of the events. In fact, that goes for the entire game in general - you can control what your character says to an extent but everything else is completely railroaded.
reviews.author: Jeff Peterson

reviews.title: Huge disappointment
reviews.comment: If you\'re anything like me, you\'ve played the first Choice of the Vampire many times and explored every option. I love the first game with all my heart.  That being said, the second installment completely disappointed me. The story is incredibly short, the characters have very little importance (or need to get to know them), and your choices just don\'t impact the storyline. I felt like I was simply reading a novel (albeit short), not playing a CoG.  I\'ve been waiting years for this. I even bought a Google Play card the day it came out so I could get this.  Not only do I regret the $3 I just spent, but I\'m also worried about where Choice of Games intends to go from here.   Simply put, don\'t waste your money. I\'m only giving it two stars because of the amazing part one. :(
reviews.author: Bre Legan

reviews.title: Disappointed
reviews.comment: Very short with a lack of ability from the player to impact the story. Certains stats are useless and you have to min/max to accomplish anything productive.
reviews.author: Clifford Campbell

reviews.title: There Are No Choices!
reviews.comment: I really liked the first game, but this one forces the storyline on you, and you can\'t get the proper combination of stats. But the worst part is that you can\'t get elected senator, even with a high status. So don\'t buy this waste of money.
reviews.author: patrick bottamedi

reviews.title: Great
reviews.comment: It did not hold the same freedom that the first chapter did, i would have much enjoyed to explore out of Memphis but it was still great, i look forward to the third installment of choice of the vampire
reviews.author: Freefall ryan

reviews.title: Good but shorter
reviews.comment: Still good but the first was better, on my opinion.
reviews.author: Craig Barnett

reviews.title: So short, and not much to show for it
reviews.comment: I was shocked to hit the end so soon, and it seemed like my choices had no effect whatsoever. I never thought I\'d regret a $3 purchase until today. I don\'t even know how many months I waited for this and it\'s over in an hour.
reviews.author: Chris Bryant

reviews.comment: It\'s a waste of money
reviews.author: Lethal L
